thread.title_full: Authorities: 2 potential jurors chatted about Philip Chism case | Boston Herald

author: O’Ryan Johnson
title: Authorities: 2 potential jurors chatted about Philip Chism case
text:
Two potential jurors in the Philip Chism murder trial talked about the case to others in the jury pool, potentially tainting those who will decide the alleged killer’s fate, authorities said this morning.
The Essex County District Attorney is reviewing whether Juror 39, a Danvers man who spoke about the case, violated the law and should face charges. All but one of the people who he talked to have been dismissed.
A female potential juror also spoke about the case, which led to the dismissal of one member of the jury pool.
A hearing on what, if any, damage that caused the jury pool is set for this morning. The defense has asked the judge to dismiss all of the jury pool.
Chism’s lawyer, Denise Regan, said a juror recounted what she heard:
“There was a person speaking in the jury room . ... Something like, that he had already been to trial ... something like, he pleaded insanity.”
Regan said five other potential jurors heard the comments and should be dismissed.
“This is erroneous and prejudicial information that has no place in the jury room,” Regan said.
Judge David Lowy said “it wouldn’t be prudent” to dismiss those jurors.
“The commonwealth is entitled to a fair trial, just as the defendant is entitled to a fair trial,” he said.
Chism’s mother was hospitalized last night, defense lawyer Susan Oker said. Lowy appointed a guardian ad litem for Chism until his mother is medically able to be available.
Chism is facing charges for first degree murder, two counts of aggravated rape, and armed robbery in Essex County Superior Court in Salem. The victim, Colleen Ritzer, was Chism’s algebra teacher at Danvers High School.
